XL9284P_syn_1:
Indication: RUL Nodule (19mm).
Proc: Nav Bronch, Radial EBUS.
Actions:
- EM Nav to RUL posterior.
- REBUS: Concentric view.
- TBNA x2, Forceps x4, Brush x2.
- CBCT: No pneumo.
Result: Tool-in-lesion confirmed.
XL9284P_syn_2: PROCEDURE NOTE: Navigational bronchoscopy was performed for a 19mm RUL nodule. Using Cone Beam CT (CBCT) and Electromagnetic Navigation (EMN), the lesion was targeted. Radial EBUS confirmed a concentric view. Diagnostic sampling included transbronchial needle aspiration (x2), forceps biopsy (x4), and brush cytology (x2). Post-procedure CBCT ruled out pneumothorax.
XL9284P_syn_3:
Codes: 31627 (Nav), 31654 (REBUS), 31629 (TBNA), 31628 (Biopsy), 31623 (Brush - usually bundled).
Target: RUL Peripheral Nodule.
Tech: EM Nav + CBCT + Radial EBUS.
Samples: TBNA x2, Biopsy x4, Brush x2.
XL9284P_syn_4:
Procedure: Navigational Bronchoscopy
Patient: [REDACTED]
Steps:
1. Deep sedation/LMA.
2. Registered EM map.
3. Navigated to RUL nodule.
4. Radial EBUS confirmed position.
5. Took needle, forcep, and brush samples.
6. Spin CT to check placement and pneumo.
Plan: Discharge.
XL9284P_syn_5: paul anderson for the rul nodule. used the super dimension or whatever nav system we have plus the cone beam. found the spot in the posterior segment. radial ebus was concentric perfect. took needle biopsies forceps and brush. checked with the spin at the end no pneumo. patient good.
XL9284P_syn_6: Name: [REDACTED]. Indication: RUL peripheral nodule 19mm. Technology: Cone beam CT, EM navigation. Procedure: Target RUL posterior segment. Radial EBUS Concentric. Samples: Needle aspiration x2, Forceps biopsy x4, Brush cytology x2. Tool-in-lesion: CONFIRMED. Post-procedure CBCT: No pneumothorax.
XL9284P_syn_7:
[Indication]
RUL nodule, 19mm.
[Anesthesia]
Deep (Propofol).
[Description]
EM Nav and CBCT used to locate lesion. Radial EBUS concentric. TBNA x2, Forceps x4, Brush x2 performed. Tool-in-lesion confirmed.
[Plan]
Discharge.
XL9284P_syn_8: We used the navigation system and the cone-beam CT to biopsy [REDACTED]. We found the 19mm spot in the right upper lobe. The radial EBUS probe showed we were right in the middle of it. We took needle samples, forceps biopsies, and some brushings. A final scan showed no collapsed lung, and he's recovering well.
XL9284P_syn_9:
Procedure: Electromagnetic navigational bronchoscopy with peripheral localization.
Target: RUL pulmonary nodule.
Technique: CBCT registration. Radial EBUS confirmation. Sampling via aspiration, forceps extraction, and cytology brushing.
Outcome: Successful localization, no pneumothorax.
XL9284P:
Name: [REDACTED] / MRN: [REDACTED] / Date of Birth: [REDACTED]

Indication → RUL peripheral nodule 19mm, part-solid, indeterminate on PET (SUV 2.1)

Deep sedation: Propofol infusion 50-75 mcg/kg/min
Ramsay 4, airway maintained with LMA
Monitoring: Continuous BP via arterial line, SpO2, ETCO2

Technology: Cone beam CT integrated with EM navigation system

Procedure:
1. Initial CBCT acquired for registration
2. EM navigation tracking deployed
3. Target: RUL posterior segment nodule
4. Guide sheath advanced under EM + fluoroscopic guidance
5. Radial EBUS: Concentric pattern confirmed ✓
6. Sampling completed
7. CBCT repeated to confirm sheath position and check for pneumothorax

Fluoroscopy metrics:
- Time: 4.8 minutes
- DAP: 178 cGy*cm² (including CBCT)

Samples:
- Needle aspiration ×2
- Forceps biopsy ×4
- Brush cytology ×2

Tool-in-lesion: CONFIRMED
Localization success: YES
Protocol adherent: YES

Post-procedure CBCT: No pneumothorax id[REDACTED]

No complications. Patient recovered smoothly, discharged after 2 hours.
